oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Roger Cook Interview by John Lomax III Side Two
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is an interview of Roger Cook by John Lomax III. The interview takes place on 1-14-81.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Roger Cook
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Side Two - (0:04) -- Continued discussion about the film "Honky Tonk Freeway." John Lomax asks Roger Cook about why George Martin came to Nashville to produce the music for the film. (2:55) -- Roger Cook describes the personnel for the soundtrack of "Honky Tonk Freeway." (4:12) -- Roger Cook describes his hesitations about singing other artists' music. (6:09) -- Roger Cook mentions that he'd love to cut the song "I'll Cross Over Jordan Someday." Roger Cook also mentions that he'd love to record a John Prine song, and a tune entitled "Only Love." (7:36) -- John Lomax asks Roger Cook about the song "I Believe In You." (9:05) -- John Lomax asks Roger Cook about his song "Years From Now." (10:33) -- Roger Cook explains Don Williams' mentality behind choosing songs to record.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Cook, Roger (Vocalist);
